alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carroll and central Grayson Counties and the City of Galax through 545 PM EDT... At 453 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elk Creek, or near Independence, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Galax... Hillsville... Independence... Fries... Byllesby... Baywood... and Flatridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
